storyInfo: Fang is thoroughly perturbed by her command mistakes during her first formal leadership of a combat team. Fortunately, she's willing to seek advice from her teammates, and they're all happy to help her resolve the confusion in her heart.

attributes.content: 11:00 A.M., Somewhere in the countryside
We have entered Area 10 according to plan. Enemy presence sighted at three o'clock.
attributes.name: Lens

attributes.content: How many left?
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: ...Scan complete. Three within visible range.
attributes.name: Lens

attributes.content: There were four who fled for Area 10 just now. If we wipe out the opposing forces here, we can prevent the other side from returning combat intelligence. It'll give us an incredible advantage for our second assault.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: These three... we can't let them go, and we need to find the fourth too.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: I'll go pin them down! The rest of you, just stick to the plan!
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Stick to... the plan? Captain Fang, what am I supposed to be doing?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: (Huh? Did I forget to explain again?)
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Aciddrop, you find high ground and provide cover fire, risk mitigation. Frostleaf, stay behind me, and attack as soon as we catch the enemy.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Lens, keep tabs on the full field of view, and you have to ensure Scene's safety.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Understood. Currently verifying Lens composite camouflage defense and concealment status.
attributes.name: Lens

attributes.content: Huh? There's a burnt smell...
attributes.name: Frostleaf

attributes.content: ...It's an ambush from the fourth target! Sure enough, they weren't just retreating, they wanted to trick us into falling for their trap.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Aciddrop, it's up to you!
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Wha? So you want me igniting the ambush?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: It's set to my left. You deal with the trap, Frostleaf and I will go catch the leftovers—
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Got it. Check this.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Wait up... Captain Fang, target's out of my attack range. I'm switching positions—
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: (Ah, Aciddrop's specialty is high-precision, close-range fire. Her position there was too far for her fire to reach.)
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: (I just planned around Kroos's attack patterns out of habit...)
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Captain Fang, Target 4... Target 4 is not ahead, they are behind—
attributes.name: Lens

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: It's an ambush! Captain!
attributes.name: Frostleaf

attributes.content: Dammit, that's how they're countering Aciddrop—
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: *cough*, *cough* *cough*... What the—
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Aciddrop, Aciddrop, please respond. Your signal has been interrupted—
attributes.name: Lens

attributes.content: I'll go look for her.
attributes.name: Frostleaf

attributes.content: Okay, Frostleaf. You assist Aciddrop, and withdraw from the trap position. I'll find the fourth guy... I can't let anyone get away.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Aciddrop, can you hear me? Aciddrop!
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Captain Fang... I'm alright, the explosion just rocked my comms. *cough*...
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: I've found you... scoundrel!
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Urghh!!
Found her. Captain, Aciddrop is hurt.
attributes.name: Frostleaf

attributes.content: It's light injuries, no big. They'll be fine once I'm on the move. Relax, Captain Fang, I'm still good to fight.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Captain?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: We can retreat for now. Lens, any other risks on the map?
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Area 10 is now fully secured. Further, no sign of danger on evacuation route.
attributes.name: Lens

attributes.content: Hold on, I'm alright. Captain Fang, there's still the three guys from...
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: All four have been dealt with. Our mission is already complete. Area 10 is secured.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Let's pull out for the time being.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: ...Sorry.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Ten minutes later...
Aciddrop... your wounds...
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: I'm chill... *cough*, I'm seriously alright, Captain Fang! My board covered me from pretty much most of the explosion damage, I just kinda fell and got a scrape or two.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: I'm sorry... I can't believe I'm the reason you got hurt.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: I should've obviously just kept up the search-and-destroy in Area 10, and we would've safely and promptly withdrawn in the end. It's all my fault...
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Captain...? I'm being serious, I'm fine. See? For real, it's only a few scrapes. I'm cool for the next phase of the mission, I'm at like 90% here!
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: The other squads should be rendezvousing very soon.
attributes.name: Frostleaf

attributes.content: Our mission's first phase is complete either way. Now we just wait to converge and carry out the next wave of our formal assault.
attributes.name: Frostleaf

attributes.content: I was too reckless... I clearly should've known that area had a high risk of being trapped, and yet I was the first to charge in.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Your judgment wasn't at all flawed, Captain. We were just slightly disjointed in that last mission, but we didn't lose any opportunity to carry out our search-and-destroy.
attributes.name: Frostleaf

attributes.content: Though it might seem extreme in hindsight, if we'd all gone on the offense together, we probably had sufficient strength to defeat them.
attributes.name: Frostleaf

attributes.content: Honestly, it's not like I don't get how you were thinking either, Captain.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: I could see the situation up from where I was stood just then.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Like, you've found their weakness already, Captain. You wanna rush the enemy directly, yeah? If we've got rear support watching for traps, we'll be good.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: It was a lapse in judgment with my command. I subconsciously... took my team members' combat styles to be those under simulated circumstances I knew better.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: I had forgotten everyone's personal strengths by the time the mission started, and employed my habitual line of thought. I took it for granted and gave you the wrong assignment, Aciddrop.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Not just that, I even failed to clearly relay the plan to my team members... and caused everyone to spend even more energy on the mission.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: I don't think you messed up at all just now, Captain. With the whole situation, putting me in charge of clearing the traps, and you and Frostleaf pursuing the enemy, that's solid tactics.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Just didn't predict the enemy would still be on the counter after that. They really bit off way more than they could chew. I mean, you dealt with them all yourself.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Miss Scene wishes to say that actually, Captain Fang truly trusts her team, and therefore believes they will understand her instructions via action?
attributes.name: Lens

attributes.content: That's...
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Every captain's style of execution has its own differences. You have your own strong points, Captain Fang.
attributes.name: Frostleaf

attributes.content: I'm kinda curious, though. You said you messed up by using a simulation you were used to? What exactly was that?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: It's... my habits with the Reserve Op Team A1, more or less. I know I'm not in any of the team's simulation exercises, but in an actual, crucial combat situation...
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Aaagh, what am I even doing?!
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: D o n ' t . . .
attributes.name: Scene

attributes.content: Calm down, calm down, Captain Fang. Miss Scene is very concerned you're blaming yourself too much.
attributes.name: Lens

attributes.content: Chill out, Captain. Mission one's basically a clean finish. Get your mood out, shake yourself off, yeah? Or, uh, if you're torn-up, you can just say. We're a team right now, y'know.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: The A1 detachment, huh... your team's a real party, right? You train together, you do simmed battles together. I bet your team coordination level's through the roof.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Thank you, Aciddrop, Scene, Frostleaf... and Lens, too.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: In all honesty... I believe that when it comes to team operability, A1 doesn't fall short against other reserve detachments.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: We've known each other for a very long time, and we've all reached the point we can fully understand each other's reasoning and operation methods. Some things we can get done even without words.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: That's so neat. I see you hanging with Beagle and Kroos all the time, too. You're really good friends too?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Yes... Before Beagle, Kroos and I came to Rhodes Island, we were an intern team at a Columbian garrison.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: That's some major force. All I ever had on the brain was skateboarding, back in Columbia. Only realized after hitting Rhodes Island, hey, when that old police guy taught me those crossbow techs? Actually got a use for those.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: If it was a competition, I'd be way below your league, Fang.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Even so, now you've adapted just fine to field combat missions, Aciddrop.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Heheh, you think so? It's not my first time getting a combat scrape, though. Always easy to lose track and get hurt, and I get my captains keyed up all the time with it.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: You'll improve with experience.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: A1's been through a lot of combat training.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: With how we've worked each other out, we've devised a set of handy signals only we understand.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: They give me the time and space to judge a situation. That gives me the opportunity to command as a captain. But...
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: But?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: To tell the truth, this is my first time directing combat as an official acting team leader...
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: I don't know why I've been unable to adjust my plans or instructions... I haven't just failed to make my orders understood, I've given the wrong orders to the wrong teammates.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: I... just can't figure it out. Apart from my own incompetence, where else could the problem lie?
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: I t ' s   n o t . . .
attributes.name: Scene

attributes.content: You can't let yourself think that way, Captain Fang! Your response and judgment just now were completely correct.
attributes.name: Lens

attributes.content: Scene and I observed very clearly in our previous battle that your assessment of the situation was abundantly exact.
attributes.name: Lens

attributes.content: You possessed the ability to rapidly locate the enemy's vital points on the front line, and were exceptionally brave in leading your charge to open the way for us.
attributes.name: Lens

attributes.content: If it's just a question of bravery, it doesn't matter who, anyone on this battlefield could...
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: It doesn't stop at bravery.
attributes.name: Frostleaf

attributes.content: Frostleaf...?
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Some people are soldiers from birth. Soldiers obedient to command.
attributes.name: Frostleaf

attributes.content: Able to consider, assess and change their approach based on the battlefield situation, but absolutely compliant to their superiors' orders.
attributes.name: Frostleaf

attributes.content: But Fang, you're not just a soldier. You also have the heart to direct us.
attributes.name: Frostleaf

attributes.content: Is that really true...? I can really do that?
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Mmhm. At least, to the best of your ability, you've enabled our team to complete this first mission.
attributes.name: Frostleaf

attributes.content: And besides, the way you lead A1 to victory out there in battle, and then come back and have such a great, friendly relationship, that all shows what a great captain you are.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: I mean, it's not like everyone's lucky enough to get set up in an reserve op team. Like me, I'm such a free spirit they won't even give me the chance.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: So buck up, Captain Fang.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Nobody thinks you gave the wrong orders. You're just hung up on doing better.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: If you would like to change, then learn from your failures. You definitely have what it takes to find a solution.
attributes.name: Lens

attributes.content: Huff... puff...
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: I got it.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: I'll keep working hard to be a good captain, but I hope you will all keep giving me suggestions on how to improve.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Well... Like, I guess I didn't really get why you went rushing on ahead, and it sorta freaked me out?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Aciddrop, I think what you are trying to say is the captain should 'improve communication.'
attributes.name: Lens

attributes.content: Yeah, that!
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Right... so I need to give clear and concise commands...
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Yes, communication is important. You act and react decisively, but it's important to make sure everyone can keep up.
attributes.name: Frostleaf

attributes.content: Get a plan in place and keep everyone safe...
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Battlefield command is very difficult, but crucial. There is no doubt you have what it takes to be captain.
attributes.name: Lens

attributes.content: But we hope you will provide more encouragement to your teammates, such that they will have even more faith in you.
attributes.name: Lens

attributes.content: Yeah, like, beyond just training, you and the A1 girls do other stuff to build teamwork, right?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Hm... we do talk strategy, I guess. And we fight, and chat, and argue...
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: You argue? That sounds like a rather intense pastime.
attributes.name: Lens

attributes.content: Yes, like at times like these, they'll be so caught up in themselves, I have to push them to rest, or they'll talk right through their break time...
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: We have thirty minutes until the next mission, so you should be resting up too. I'll wake you when it's time to move.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Wha? But I wanted to hear more about you and your reserve op team.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: We can't keep talking, you're wounded. You need your rest. Lay down, Aciddrop.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Ugh, fine. But after the mission, you've gotta gimme some real tight war stories, okay? I'm jonesing.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Alright...
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Miss Scene wants to ask if you have cheered up? She hopes that conversation was helpful to you.
attributes.name: Lens

attributes.content: Don't worry, Scene, or Lens. I just need a little alone time to think.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Yeah... good call.
attributes.name: Frostleaf

attributes.content: Fifteen days ago, Rhodes Island Training Grounds
...That's it for today.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Phew... alright.
attributes.name: Beagle

attributes.content: Finally done... huff... I'm totally spent...
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Kroos never misses a chance to catch a break... Why don't you take me up on my offer and have healthy meals with me?
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: You'll have more energy. We'll get you on a regular schedule.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: No thanks. I might be better off living like you, Hibiscus... but I think I'd rather take it easy.
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: Shhh! Kroos! The instructors are still here!
attributes.name: Beagle

attributes.content: Alright, no joking around in front of Instructor Grace. Everybody form up and head out.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Fang, hold back a second.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Huh...?
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Yes, Instructor!
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Poor Fang. Team leaders always have to stay late.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: But Fang won't mind talking to the instructor for a while more. She's so responsible and serious. I couldn't handle more lessons, but Fang...?
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: (And her tail's still flapping away. Fang really has so much energy.)
attributes.name: Beagle

attributes.content: Yeah, Fang's always worn her heart on her sleeve. Training doesn't get to her, not like us. We can't hold up in a protracted fight...
attributes.name: Kroos

attributes.content: You're the one who's always slacking off.
attributes.name: Hibiscus

attributes.content: (You two...!)
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Ah! We'd better go! Bye, Instructor Grace, Captain Fang!
attributes.name: Beagle

attributes.content: Sorry you had to see that, Instructor... I hope we don't come off too lazy...
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Relax, you're doing fine. I asked you to stay not for Reserve Op Team A1, but for you yourself.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Me?
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Correct. I've gleaned a few things from conversations with the rest of A1. There are some concerns about your leadership.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: I... I don't want to make anyone worry.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Anyone can see that A1 has grown a lot. When you're done with training, we'll break out the team members for temporary practical duty with other squads.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: And you haven't been doing too badly as captain.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: But... I almost never do that kind of temporary duty alone.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Hibiscus, Kroos, and Beagle all had great temporary duty runs, and Lava gets out there on real missions, everyone can see how well she does alone.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: But me? I may be captain, but I only pull it off with my team's support.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: I mean, I sometimes think it'd be fine to just keep on leading A1, as selfish as that is...
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: I wish A1 could stay together, but I know everyone has their own futures ahead of them. I... I know we have to move on.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Yes, well, your teammates have all talked about how you feel. They know your sense of responsibility and duty.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: And honestly, it's important for your feelings to get through to your teammates.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: I've been around the block enough that I can tell you Rhodes Island's training regimen isn't just about getting your combat scores up.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Right, I know!
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Instructor Dobermann always talks about how she wants Rhodes Island Operators to be strong and steadfast in battle, but also... to never blind themselves to the cruelty of war, to keep a beating heart.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Never see yourself as a pawn on the board.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: What that means, Fang, is a lot more opportunities for you, not only for Rhodes Island to trust in your strength, but to refresh yourself.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Re...fresh myself?
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Your A1 teammates recognize your strength, they trust in you. The understanding you have is unmatched.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Trust in yourself, but also trust in the idea that, no matter your teammates, no matter the odds, you can find a way to achieve the goal before you.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: No one person is perfect, but two, or three... when they converge, the power in the center grows, maybe at the cost of some differences and disagreements.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: I'm always pushing you one step further, Fang. Go make yourself into the leader who can guide that power in the center.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Instructor...
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: ...Yes. I... I won't give up.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Not everyone can handle the burden of command.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Alright. Believe in yourself. And remember that feeling you had today when you dove in there. You can do it.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Um... But, Instructor Grace... I kinda feel like hearing this stuff from you... it's weird.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Ahaha... is it a little different from my usual style?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Not exactly, it's just... a little more... professional? Than usual!
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Ah, you know me too well. And I think you can guess who's really telling you this stuff.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: But even if 'she' isn't here to speak up and tell you herself, she definitely hopes you can get that courage and confidence from somewhere.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Alright! I got it!
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Okay, go rest up. You'll have your first solo temporary duty assignment soon.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Huh? So soon?
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: You're not up for it?
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: Of course I am! I'll be ready...
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Don't blame me for not reminding you, the first time you make a mistake. And don't cry in front of your team.
attributes.name: Grace

attributes.content: I won't! Thank you, Instructor Grace!
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: (And thank you... Instructor Dobermann.)
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Whew... I almost lost it there. How embarrassing, hehe...
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Everyone's encouraging me. And I really do believe I can do it.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Instructor Dobermann, Instructor Grace, I... I think I finally get it. I know what it means to be trusted by your teammates, and how comforting it can be.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: I'm... the leader. I have to keep training, and take on more responsibility. That's my decision.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Half an hour later...
Phew... alright.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Team three, up!
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Whew... glad we had some time to rest.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Y e s . . .
attributes.name: Scene

attributes.content: It may have been time to rest, but Captain Fang did not close her eyes. I took many shots of the captain's serious expression as she looked through her combat intelligence.
attributes.name: Lens

attributes.content: Erm... it's nothing special...
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Phase two begins in twenty minutes. We'll form up for a joint attack with team two, moving in from Area 10, surveying the ground, and taking up a vantage point.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: We're the first to engage the enemy? Not an easy job, but seems right for us.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Captain Fang, what's the plan after that?
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: I revised my plan based on our previous engagement. Here's your copies to review.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Taking our previous experience into account, I think we'll want to take a more aggressive stance.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Lens and Scene need to stay secure, keep our communications unobstructed. The front line needs clear maps and imaging.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Aciddrop, we still want you on the high ground for covering fire. But don't spread out too much, we want you close.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Roger that! My crossbow does more damage at close range.
attributes.name: Aciddrop

attributes.content: Frostleaf, you and I will launch an attack on the center of the enemy force. Scout from concealment when you engage.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Roger.
attributes.name: Frostleaf

attributes.content: Lens's terrain imaging needs to get to team two as quickly as possible. The other team can then move to support us.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Once we break through the first enemy line, we'll direct the supporting fire.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: That's all we've got for the plan before we move. Once we reach Area 10, listen for my orders.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: I... appreciate everything you said to me back there. My mistakes in the first phase cost us, we suffered a casualty. I won't make any mistakes again.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: That's the last time I'll misjudge things or give bad orders. Please, trust me.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: I now know what it means to be a team leader.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.content: Now, all hands, conduct your equipment checks before we move out.
attributes.name: Fang

attributes.text: Enemy position detected. Prepare for combat!
